TopicTitle: Kerbal survives fall from 10,000m [Kerbal Impact Tolerance Is Too High]

Articles.Content:
Reported Version: v0.1.5 (latest) | Mods: none | Can replicate without mods? Yes 
OS: Win11 | CPU: i7-12700k | GPU: RTX 3070Ti | RAM: 32GB

 

I launched a 3 part rocket (capsule, fuel, engine) at 10,000m, I eva'd the Kerbal.

Using the rocket pack I got him on a trajectory to land in water offshore of KSC.   Using UP thruster on the jetpack he was stable at 186m/s on contact with the water.

He lived!   Seems kinda sus to me.

Edited November 15, 2023 by The Space Peacock
Kerbals are made to fall from any height on Kerbin and survive. It is one of the elements from KSP1 that was kept, I believe.
Maybe due to the water, IIRC I died on land around 50m/sec, which seemed about right.
Yeah any fall into water is survivable for me.

did he land on his head?

 

everyone knows kerbals can survive any fall if they land on their head. And... don't burn up in the atmosphere.
